entry.title: üï∏ HTML (HyperText Markup Language) 2018
entry.content:
HTMLRelat√≠ve eg√©szen sok id≈ët t√∂lt√∂ttem m√°r el k√ºl√∂nb√∂z≈ë HTML-alap√∫ weboldal √∂tletek tervezget√©s√©vel √∫gy, hogy sosem olvastam m√©g el egyetlenegy aktu√°lis HTML verzi√≥ teljes dokument√°ci√≥j√°t sem az elej√©t≈ël a v√©g√©ig, √©s √≠gy sajnos sosem tudtam m√©g rendesen sem elm√©lyedni a t√©m√°ban.

Most, amikor √©pp ezzel az √∫j oldallal kis√©rleteztem, arra gondoltam, hogyha egyszer valamikor abbahagyom majd a TSM-mel ( Spectrum Protect, aka: Tivoli Storage Manager, ADSTAR Distributed Storage Manager, ADSM) val√≥ munk√°imat, akkor lehet, hogy tal√°n ez lenne az a k√∂vetkez≈ë t√©ma / ter√ºlet, amit sz√≠vesen csin√°ln√©k majd helyette.

A sok ‚Äúgondolkod√°s‚Äù k√∂zben / el≈ëtt, eg√©szen a kezdetekkor m√°r lementettem p√°r .html oldalt, amiben mind tal√°ltam valami nekem tetsz≈ë vagy √©ppen valami nekem nem tetsz≈ë dolgot √©s ham√°r √∂sszeraktam ezt az oldalt err≈ël a t√©m√°r√≥l, akkor azonnnal adta mag√°t, hogy itt lesz ezent√∫l ezenknek a r√©gen lementett k√©peknek a v√©gleges hely√ºk. Lehet, hogy egyszer azt kis le√≠rom majd, hogy melyikr≈ël mit gondolok, de nem most.

plastik.hu saved in 2010.

index.hu saved in 2012.

google.com saved in 2012.

adobe.com saved in 2012.

nol.hu saved in 2012.

microsoft.com saved in 2012.

origo.hu saved in 2012.

cnn.com saved in 2012.

ibm.com saved in 2010.

news_template.htm saved in 2010.

Tartalom saved in 2010.

Az √∫j gazdas√°g r√©gi szab√°lya saved in 2010.

google.hu saved in 2017.


Egy picit tov√°bb visszatekerve m√©g az id≈ë kerek√©t, a lementett k√©peken k√≠v√ºl, a saj√°t √∂tletekb≈ël √©s kis√©rletezget√©sekb≈ël a k√∂vetkez≈ë nekem fontos oldalak maradtak fenn:

  1. fleischmann.hu saved in 2010.

    geocities.com/gfleischmann/ saved in 2004.

    Az els≈ë saj√°t weboldalam (~1997-b≈ël) m√©g a GeoCities1 ingyenes szolg√°ltat√°s√°ra √©p√ºlt √©s amit most l√°tok csak, hogy ennek a nyomai egy lelkes internetes csoportnak (OoCities2) k√∂sz√∂nhet≈ëen m√©g mindig el√©rhet≈ëek a k√∂vetkez≈ë c√≠men is: www.oocities.org/gfleischmann. √ân, az old.fleischmann.hu/geocities.com oldalon ≈ërz√∂m az utols√≥ √°llapot√°t. Az oldal tan√∫s√°ga alapj√°n, 2003. √©v v√©g√©ig volt ez m√©g szerkesztve.

  2. Egy kisebb sz√ºnet ut√°n valamikor ~2005-t≈ël a k√∂vetez≈ë, m√°r teljesen √∫j form√°j√°ban sz√ºletett √∫jra a weboldalam: fleischmann.hu internetes domain alatt. (K√ºl√∂n k√∂sz√∂net illeti ez√©rt T√≥th Petit (G.A.M.F., Kecskem√©t) a domain n√©v regisztr√°ci√≥√©rt!) Ennek az oldalank az √∫jdons√°ga a fot√≥blogol√°s volt, amihez a statikus oldalkat egy saj√°t k√©sz√≠t√©s≈± perl szkript ‚Äúford√≠tott‚Äù le. Ez az eg√©sz fot√≥blogol√°s eg√©szen 2009 els≈ë negyed√©ig tartott. K√∂zben (~2014-ben) mag√°t az oldalt kiszolg√°l√≥ √©s hosztol√≥ fizikai g√©p (ami√©rt nem gy≈ëz√∂k ugyszint el√©gg√© h√°l√°s lenni Vihari Bal√°zsnak, (Cr√©dit Lyonnais, Budapest)) is megsz≈±nt m√°r. Az√≥ta eg√©szen 2017-ig nem is t√∂rt√©nt m√°r vele tudtommal semmi v√°ltoz√°s eg√©szen pontosan mostan√°ig, amikor is felt√∂lt√∂ttem minden √°ltalam el√©rhet≈ë arch√≠v f√°jlt a GitHub-ra √©s a pages.github.com szolg√°lt√°sra hagytam az oldalak t√©nyleges kiszolg√°l√°s√°t a kor√°bban m√°r eml√≠tett old.fleischmann.hu domain alatt.

  3. gyorgy.fleischmann.hu saved in 2017.

    √âpp amikor ezeket a felt√∂lt√©seket √©s a hozz√°juk kapcsol√≥d√≥ finom√≠t√°sokat csin√°ltam (DNS bejegyz√©sek friss√≠t√©se, r√©gi karakter k√≥dol√°sok jav√≠t√°sa a GitHub-hoz, Google Analytics √∫jra√©leszt√©se) gondoltam arra, hogy mi lenne akkor, ha ide √∫jra k√©sz√≠ten√©k m√°r egy teljesen √∫j oldalt is, az itt adott technik√°kkal (GitHub, jekyll, HTML5, CSS3). Els≈ë k√∂rben a k√∂vetkez≈ëket t≈±ztem ki c√©lul:

    • tudjon majd kezelni sorkiz√°rt sz√∂vegeket √∫gy, hogy dinamikusan kezeljen ezzel egy√ºtt jobbra/balra igaz√≠tott k√©peket vagy sz√∂vegdobozokat is;
    • valahogy lehessen inici√°l√©kat tenni a bekezd√©sek el√©;
    • lehessen termin√°l szer≈± (fekete ablak) p√©ld√°kat beid√©zni;
    • mag√°t√≥l kezeljen forr√°sprogrami p√©ld√°kat sz√©pen sz√≠nezve a szintaxiskiemel√©seket (syntax highlighting);
    • lehessen fot√≥szeteket kezelni √©s legyen hozz√° egy egyszer≈±en haszn√°lhat√≥ teljesk√©perny≈ës fot√≥ megjelen√≠t≈ë;
    • tudjon m√©diaf√°jlokat kezelni: .mp3, .mp4, youtube, vimeo, soundcloud, ‚Ä¶;
    • norm√°lisan kezelje a markdown f√°jl form√°z√≥ lehet≈ës√©geit;
    • a nyomtatott v√°ltozat is √©rtkelhet≈ë kimenetet eredm√©nyezzen;

A meg√°lmodott √©s v√©g√ºl elk√©sz√≠tett megold√°st itt: jekyll tesztoldalam √©s jekyll tesztoldalam2 teszteltem.

Persze lehetne m√©g ezt az eg√©sz diz√°jnt -, ha nevezhetj√ºk ezt egy√°ltal√°n annak - is a v√©gtelens√©gig csiszolgatni, de √©n most itt, ezen a ponton egyel≈ëre abbahagyom, mert eddig okozott a bel√© fektetett munka √∂r√∂m√∂t, boldog√°sgot √©s nem szeren√©m, ha ez a v√©g√©n esetleg m√©g rossz ir√°nyba v√°ltozna meg!

  1. Yahoo! GeoCities a Wikipedi√°n¬†↩

  2. OoCities¬†↩

entry.title: üë®üèª‚Äçüéì CV
entry.content:
FLEISCHMANN Gy√∂rgy ‚Ä¢ nick names: flex, gyurci, FleXoft

@flexoft ‚Ä¢+36 30 979 1403 ‚Ä¢ gyorgy@fleischmann.hu ‚Ä¢ H-1185, Budapest, Ungv√°r utca 33/1., HUNGARY

SUMMARY

Photo by me, 2016.11.11., Minolta Dynax 7D, 50mm

Highly qualified certified systems engineer / architect / consultant with more than 13 years of experience in designing, building and supporting complex Spectrum Protect (aka: Tivoli Storage Manager, TSM, ADSTAR Distributed Storage Manager, ADSM) at the biggest Hungarian companies.

One of the well-known IBM TSM / Spectrum Protect experts / evangelists in Hungary. Enthusiastic member of the Hungarian Tivoli User Group (Hu-TUG). Regular speaker at biannual events in IBM TSM / Spectrum Protect related topics.

Team player and problem-solver with very good communication and interpersonal skills.

FAMILY

more / less

Moh√°cs, Baranya ‚Ä¢ HUNGARY

37-14 ‚Ä¢ mother, Zsuzsanna ‚Ä¢
45-na ‚Ä¢ father, Gy√∂rgy ‚Ä¢
57-na ‚Ä¢ stepbrother, Istv√°n ‚Ä¢
70-na ‚Ä¢
74-na ‚Ä¢ wife, Hajnalka ‚Ä¢
01-na ‚Ä¢ Anna ‚Ä¢
05-na ‚Ä¢ Gerg≈ë ‚Ä¢
17-na ‚Ä¢ Andr√°s ‚Ä¢

WORK

more / less

Budapest, Pest ‚Ä¢ HUNGARY

15-na ‚Ä¢

System engineer, IBM Spectrum Protect (Tivoli Storage Manager) specialist ‚Ä¢ SCSS Informatikai, Kereskedelmi √©s Szolg√°ltat√≥ Kft., Effective Group Informatika Zrt.
  • Supporting a dozen large IBM TSM, SP customers in Hungary
  • Supporting IBM GPFS, Spectrum Scale cutomers with TSM / SP HSM
  • TSM Symposium, 15 (Dresden)
  • Speaker of IBM, RRC Systems Day (Effective storage usage in backup environments, real implementation experiences), 17
Main projects and references:
  • 7/24 high availability TSM v6, v7, v8 support for:
    • MKB Bank (>3Y): 4 TSM servers on a HP-UX cluster environment with library manager configuration and other 2 TSM servers (IBM AIX) for document archiving systems
    • Generali Biztos√≠t√≥ (>2Y): 2 general TSM servers on Microsoft Windows and other 2 TSM (IBM AIX) servers for document store systems
    • MTVA (>3Y): TSM on a Microsoft Windows cluster, node replication, container pool deduplication environments and TSM on Linux with GPFS filesystems
    • MVMI, NAK(Nemzeti Agr√°rgazdas√°gi Kamara), Di√°khitel, EOS, FGSZ, FPH
04-14 ‚Ä¢

System engineer, IBM Tivoli Storage Manager specialist ‚Ä¢ USER Tan√°csad√≥ Kft., USER Rendszerh√°z Kft. (IBM Tivoli Awards, 12 ‚Ä¢ IBM AAA-level Tivoli Deployment Accreditation, 13)
  • Supporting a dozen large IBM TSM customers in Hungary
  • Participation the biggest IBM TSM related events (IBM C&SI EMEA Technical Academy, 14 (Madrid) ‚Ä¢ IBM Tivoli Technical Academy, 13 (Reading) ‚Ä¢ TSM Symposium, 11 (Dresden))
  • Architect / integrate big IBM TSM configurations
  • Troubleshoot / consult performance, backup, restore issues
  • Member of several IBM TSM API based development
  • Health check, operate, maintain big IBM TSM environments
  • Speaker of VMware Cloud Day (Backing up VMware with IBM technology), 13
Main projects and references:
  • 7/24 high availability TSM v5, v6 support for:
    • MKB Bank (>10Y): 4 TSM servers on a HP-UX cluster environment with library manager configuration and other 2 TSM servers (IBM AIX) for document archiving systems
    • Allianz Biztos√≠t√≥ (>10Y): TSM on a HA AIX environment with library manager configuration and other 2 TSM servers for document store systems
    • Generali Biztos√≠t√≥ (>10Y): 4 general TSM servers on Microsoft Windows for the region and other 2 TSM servers on IBM AIX for document store systems
    • FHB Bank (>2Y): TSM on a AIX HA environment
    • Budapest Bank (>10Y): 2 TSM servers on a HA AIX environment
    • Chello Central Europe (>8Y): biggest TSM based video media archiving environment implementation and support
    • HVB/UniCredit Bank (>10Y): the first v5 ‚Äì> v6 migrated AIX TSM systems on an IBM PureFlex system in the region
  • TSM v5 -> v6 migration (TSM DB > 300GB) (OEP, UniCredit Bank, Generali Biztos√≠t√≥, MKB Bank)
  • v6 TSM based backup solutions for IBM PureFlex based environments and support (iCell, NISZ)
  • TSM v5 -> v6 migration consultation at HSBC Turkey (Istanbul)
  • Dealt with IBM SoftLayer fundamentals (Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS))
01-03 ‚Ä¢

Network / IBM Lotus Notes / Domino administrator ‚Ä¢ Schneider Electric Hung√°ria Villamoss√°gi Rt.
  • IBM Lotus Notes administrator (450 users; Austria, Slovak Republic, Slovenia, Croatia, Yugoslavia) and developer
  • operating the whole network
  • work in S.A.P. R3 environment (COMPAQ/Digital, True64 UNIX)
  • organised and successfully started the new logistics center of Schneider Electric Hung√°ria Villamoss√°gi Rt. in Harbor Park (Frame Relay connection to the center, phone network, computer network, wireless phone (DECT), wireless network (based on Cisco Aironet 340, 350 series), Novell Netware, ...)
  • working with the following systems and equipments: CheckPoint firewall, Netscape iPlanet Web server, Netscape CMS server, Netscape Proxy server, Novell Netware 5.x, Intel Shiva + Radius, Nortel network equipments (switches, routers, hubs), ntp, ...
  • prepared: SMS gateway (Linux + perl + Nokia 6210), webcamera (Linux + V4L + bttv)
  • started the intranet in Hungary (based on IBM Lotus Notes, WIB)
98-01 ‚Ä¢

Office Automation Officer ‚Ä¢ Soci√©t√© G√©n√©rale Hung√°ria Bank Inc.
  • we built up the whole information system of this new bank (with two of my colleagues) from the ground
  • Lotus Notes administrator and developer
  • working with GIRO, SWIFT and the local accounting system
  • installing and supporting SogeCash (MultiCash based) remote bank system
97-98 ‚Ä¢

EDP assistent ‚Ä¢ Cr√©dit Lyonnais Bank Hungary Inc.
  • learning to use and operate the new systems (HP-UX, HP PCs, Microsoft WindowsNT network, SQL, TCP/IP)
  • worked with GIRO, SWIFT, Lotus Notes and the local accounting system

Moh√°cs, Baranya ‚Ä¢ HUNGARY

91-97 ‚Ä¢

System engineer ‚Ä¢ Fibreboard Factory (M.O.F.A.) Inc.
  • learned to use i8048 and i8051 microcontrollers
  • December 1991 - August 1992 programmer assistant, computer technology collaborator
  • learned to use the local network, programmed in C language
  • March 1994 - March 1997 computer technology organizer
  • extended the network of the company, connected its existing systems, worked independently, maintained and controlled the whole system
  • formed new concepts in the information technology system of the company, established the e-mail system and the DIAL-IN accessibility of the network, developed ONLINE systems and established these systems on the existing network
  • software legalization
  • established and maintained several Novell NetWare based networks in Moh√°cs city

EDUCATION

Kecskem√©t, B√°cs-Kiskun ‚Ä¢ HUNGARY

88-91 ‚Ä¢

Technical College of Machine Industry and Automation (G.A.M.F.) ‚Ä¢ specialization: computer technology

Moh√°cs, Baranya ‚Ä¢ HUNGARY

84-88 ‚Ä¢

Kisfaludy K√°roly Secondary School ‚Ä¢ faculties: mathematics, physics

TECHNICAL SKILLS

Operating systems

UNIX ‚Ä¢ Microsoft Windows ‚Ä¢ Apple macOS (OS X)

Programming languages

Objective-C (applications with Core Location framework, 13 and BLE, 17) ‚Ä¢ C (kernel mode device driver on Linux, TSM API) ‚Ä¢ 80x86 assembly (direct IPX protocol programming) ‚Ä¢ ATMEL AVR assembly, C (GSM based home automation, 09) ‚Ä¢ Epson S1C88 assembly (code breaker game, 04) ‚Ä¢ CA Clipper ‚Ä¢ DataFlex ‚Ä¢ perl (tsmadm.pl, 13) ‚Ä¢ awk ‚Ä¢ UNIX shell ‚Ä¢ Psion OPL (PhotoPal, 01) ‚Ä¢ Lotus Formula ‚Ä¢ Lotus Script (incident log system) ‚Ä¢ JavaScript

Hardware

IBM TSM / Spectrum Protect related

Daily TSM administration and 7/24 support for banks, insurance companies, broadcasting companies and state sector ‚Ä¢ Co-author of the tsmadmin.com blog ‚Ä¢ Founder of the tsmadm.pl free IBM TSM administration tool ‚Ä¢ The person who opens / closes the most tickets (IBM PMR, Problem Management Report) each year in Hungary ‚Ä¢ Took IBM TSM / Spectrum Protect (implementation, operation, administration, advanced administration) trainings (>30, on behalf of IBM, IQSOFT - John Bryce Oktat√≥k√∂zpont Kft. and Training 360 Kft.)

Professional Certifications

  • Veeam Technical Sales Professional (VMTSP) - Veeam Availability Suite v9.5 ‚Ä¢ 09/28/2017
  • IBM Certified Deployment Professional - Spectrum Protect V8.1 ‚Ä¢ 07/28/2017
  • IBM Certified Deployment Professional - Tivoli Storage Manager V7.1 ‚Ä¢ 05/18/2015

entry.content:

Nagyon h√°l√°s t√©m√°nak tartom mag√°t az eg√©sz √úll≈ëi utat fot√≥zgatni nap, mint nap, mert sok m√°s magyarorsz√°gi t√©m√°val egy√ºtt, ez is igaz√°n egyedi szociolenyomata ennek az orsz√°gnak.

Id√©n, Anna sz√ºlinapj√°n, v√©g√ºl hossz√∫ v√°rakoz√°s ut√°n azt gondoltam, hogy egy√ºtt, egy k√∂z√∂s sz√ºlinapi eb√©dre bevillamosozva a v√°ros fel√©, v√©gre megn√©zz√ºk k√∂zelebbr≈ël is ezt a t√©m√°t. V√©g√ºl az √∫t sor√°n, teszt jelleggel ezek a k√©pek k√©sz√ºltek, sajnos csak mobiltelefonnal‚Ä¶ ‚òπÔ∏è A v√°rt hat√°s m√©g sajnos nincs meg, de egy tesztnek mindenk√©ppen j√≥ volt.

entry.title: Jekyll test page
entry.content:
Tweets by FleXoft

Aenean non sapien sit amet eros pulvinar rutrum. Phasellus quis gravida lorem, vulputate sollicitudin mi. Sed tempus tincidunt ipsum, sit amet pulvinar enim dictum eu. Etiam feugiat accumsan velit. Sed euismod euismod elit auctor iaculis. Curabitur eu ipsum sodales, luctus dolor non, tempus magna. Donec aliquam, magna sit amet interdum pretium, odio justo molestie mi, quis feugiat ligula tortor auctor metus. Pellentesque sapien odio, pharetra non felis in, mollis aliquet mauris.


#! /bin/sh
echo alma
echo Hello word.
>> alma

Integer odio tortor, tempor at diam quis, rhoncus elementum risus. Phasellus mollis quis tortor ut tincidunt. Curabitur consequat ipsum quis nisi eleifend, vitae malesuada nunc rutrum. Aliquam sapien odio, ultricies fringilla turpis eu, elementum posuere purus. Ut iaculis ac ante vel aliquam. Nulla vel feugiat diam, vitae gravida orci. Interdum et malesuada fames ac ante ipsum primis in faucibus. Morbi semper sapien et velit rhoncus tincidunt. Sed at eros ornare, egestas diam ac, interdum sapien. Ut sapien metus, faucibus at feugiat et, luctus at urna. Morbi luctus nisi orci, quis rhoncus mi accumsan sed. Sed vulputate et risus eu rhoncus. Donec a quam id erat suscipit bibendum. Donec viverra leo a sodales luctus. Curabitur pretium diam a est condimentum pretium vel nec eros.

Added a new repo, that is, /maps for hosting ‚Äòfull-screen‚Äô interactive beer maps with brewery listings.

See an example beer map for Austria (~200 breweries n brewpubs) live or check the source using the mapbox.js mapping library.

MacDown


Hello there! I‚Äôm MacDown, the open source Markdown editor for OS X.

Let me introduce myself.

H2

H3

You can specify extra HTML rendering options through the Rendering preference pane.

You can customize the editor window to you liking in the Editor preferences pane:

You can configure various application (that‚Äôs me!) behaviors in the General preference pane.

The Basics

Before I tell you about all the extra syntaxes and capabilities I have, I‚Äôll introduce you to the basics of standard markdown. If you already know markdown, and want to jump straight to learning about the fancier things I can do, I suggest you skip to the Markdown preference pane. Lets jump right in.

Line Breaks

To force a line break, put two spaces and a newline (return) at the end of the line.

  • This two-line bullet won‚Äôt break

  • This two-line bullet
    will break

Here is the code:

* This two-line bullet 
won't break

* This two-line bullet  
will break

Strong and Emphasize

Strong: **Strong** or __Strong__ (Command-B)
Emphasize: *Emphasize* or _Emphasize_1 (Command-I)

Headers (like this one!)

Header 1
========

Header 2
--------

or

# Header 1
## Header 2
### Header 3
#### Header 4
##### Header 5
###### Header 6

Links and Email

Inline

Just put angle brackets around an email and it becomes clickable: uranusjr@gmail.com
<uranusjr@gmail.com>

Same thing with urls: http://macdown.uranusjr.com
` http://macdown.uranusjr.com`

Perhaps you want to some link text like this: Macdown Website
[Macdown Website](http://macdown.uranusjr.com "Title") (The title is optional)

Reference style

Sometimes it looks too messy to include big long urls inline, or you want to keep all your urls together.

Make a link [a link][arbitrary_id] then on it‚Äôs own line anywhere else in the file:
[arbitrary_id]: http://macdown.uranusjr.com "Title"

If the link text itself would make a good id, you can link like this [like this][], then on it‚Äôs own line anywhere else in the file:
[like this]: http://macdown.uranusjr.com

Images

Inline

![Alt Image Text](path/or/url/to.jpg "Optional Title")

Reference style

![Alt Image Text][image-id]
on it‚Äôs own line elsewhere:
[image-id]: path/or/url/to.jpg "Optional Title"

Lists

  • Lists must be preceded by a blank line (or block element)
  • Unordered lists start each item with a *
  • - works too
    • Indent a level to make a nested list
      1. Ordered lists are supported.
      2. Start each item (number-period-space) like 1.
      3. It doesn‚Äôt matter what number you use, I will render them sequentially
      4. So you might want to start each line with 1. and let me sort it out

Here is the code:

* Lists must be preceded by a blank line (or block element)
* Unordered lists start each item with a `*`
- `-` works too
    * Indent a level to make a nested list
	1. Ordered lists are supported.
	2. Start each item (number-period-space) like `1. `
	42. It doesn't matter what number you use, I will render them sequentially
	1. So you might want to start each line with `1.` and let me sort it out

Block Quote

Angle brackets > are used for block quotes.
Technically not every line needs to start with a > as long as there are no empty lines between paragraphs.
Looks kinda ugly though.

Block quotes can be nested.

Multiple Levels

Most markdown syntaxes work inside block quotes.

  • Lists
  • Links
  • Etc.

Here is the code:

> Angle brackets `>` are used for block quotes.  
Technically not every line needs to start with a `>` as long as
there are no empty lines between paragraphs.  
> Looks kinda ugly though.
> > Block quotes can be nested.  
> > > Multiple Levels
>
> Most markdown syntaxes work inside block quotes.
>
> * Lists
> * [Links][arbitrary_id]
> * Etc.

Inline Code

Inline code is indicated by surrounding it with backticks:
`Inline code`

If your code has `backticks` that need to be displayed, you can use double backticks: ``Code with `backticks` `` (mind the spaces preceding the final set of backticks)

Block Code

If you indent at least four spaces or one tab, I‚Äôll display a code block.

print('This is a code block')
print('The block must be preceded by a blank line')
print('Then indent at least 4 spaces or 1 tab')
print('Nesting does nothing. Your code is displayed Literally')

I also know how to do something called Fenced Code Blocks which I will tell you about later.

Horizontal Rules

If you type three asterisks *** or three dashes --- on a line, I‚Äôll display a horizontal rule:

Document Formatting

The Smartypants extension automatically transforms straight quotes (" and ') in your text into typographer‚Äôs quotes (‚Äú, ‚Äù, ‚Äò, and ‚Äô) according to the context. Very useful if you‚Äôre a typography freak like I am. Quote and Smartypants are syntactically incompatible. If both are enabled, Quote takes precedence.

Block Formatting

Table

This is a table:

First Header Second Header
Content Cell Content Cell
Content Cell Content Cell

You can align cell contents with syntax like this:

Left Aligned Center Aligned Right Aligned
col 3 is some wordy text $1600
col 2 is centered $12
zebra stripes are neat $1

The left- and right-most pipes (|) are only aesthetic, and can be omitted. The spaces don‚Äôt matter, either. Alignment depends solely on : marks.

Fenced Code Block

This is a fenced code block:

print('Hello world!')

You can also use waves (~) instead of back ticks (`):

print('Hello world!')

Inline Formatting

The following is a list of optional inline markups supported:

Option name Markup Result if enabled
Intra-word emphasis So A*maz*ing So Amazing
Strikethrough ~~Much wow~~ Much wow
Underline 2 _So doge_ So doge
Quote 3 "Such editor" Such editor
Highlight ==So good== So good
Superscript hoge\^(fuga) hogefuga
Autolink http://t.co http://t.co
Footnotes [\^4] and [\^4]: 4 and footnote 4

Hack On

That‚Äôs about it. Thanks for listening. I‚Äôll be quiet from now on (unless there‚Äôs an update about the app‚ÄîI‚Äôll remind you for that!).

Happy writing!

  1. If Underlines is turned on, _this notation_ will render as underlined instead of emphasized¬†↩

  2. If Underline is disabled _this_ will be rendered as emphasized instead of being underlined.¬†↩

  3. Quote replaces literal " characters with html <q> tags. Quote and Smartypants are syntactically incompatible. If both are enabled, Quote takes precedence. Note that Quote is different from blockquote, which is part of standard Markdown.¬†↩

  4. You don‚Äôt have to use a number. Arbitrary things like [^footy note4] and [^footy note4]: will also work. But they will render as numbered footnotes. Also, no need to keep your footnotes in order, I will sort out the order for you so they appear in the same order they were referenced in the text body. You can even keep some footnotes near where you referenced them, and collect others at the bottom of the file in the traditional place for footnotes.¬†↩
